channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Ivor Williams Trailer left half on road/half on pavement for 6 mths, 22nd March
item.description:
The owners of one of the new bungalows on Westbury Road have left their trailer parked half on and half off the pavement nowhere near their own residence. The trailer has effectively been abandoned. It has been abandoned opposite No 44 Westbury Road causing a constant obstruction to all traffic on the road but in particular to the owner of No 44 and their relatives/friends entering and existing their own driveway. It is a narrow, residential and circular street with blind bends. The trailer has not been moved/used for at least 6 months.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 23, Westbury Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Approaching the roundabout by brizen field from Shurdington road, 22nd March
item.description:
This particular pot hole is about 1.5mtrs long and 300 wide just as your approaching the roundabout from Shurdington road to go to up Hatherley way. This would definitely have someone of their motorcycle if they hit it in the dark. It is bad enough hitting it in a car
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shurdington Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Huge pothole just past the bridge heading towards Staverton, 22nd March
item.description:
Badgeworth Road, Cheltenham. Just over the bridge, heading towards Staverton. Just had to replace my tyre because of it . Noticed it last week .
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Badgeworth Road, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury

item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Poor parking on corner, 22nd March
item.description:
I wish to report a vehicle that is often parked on corner of Moorfield Road, Brockworth, Gloucester that is parked causing poor visibility for vehicles driving past Riversmeet flats. There has already been 2 RTC's involving other vehicles (Police called) either due to the obstruction or by drivers not paying attention, either way this is not ideal and the only way to mitigate further issues is for double yellow lines ti be painted. Just to clarify I am NOT reporting an abandoned vehicle.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Moorfield Road, Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple deep potholes, 22nd March
item.description:
The whole stretch of road from Christchurch Rd to Malvern Place is in tatters. It has damaged my bicycle wheels and creates danger as I swerve to avoid potholes. Please can this whole stretch be addressed as a priority.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Drakes Place, Montpellier, Cheltenham

item.title: Collapsed drain -, 22nd March
item.description:
This has been repaired 2 or 3 times and has collapsed again. It has been coned off for 2 weeks but is creating a hazard as it narrows road from 2 lanes to 1 and a half immediately after the traffic lights. Needs repairing properly please
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A435, Bishop's Cleeve

item.title: Refuse bin is not secured to ground, 21st March
item.description:
People are constantly kicking this bin over. Please secure it to the floor properly. It is not held down in any way, and so it is more often than not found in a horizontal position on the grass.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 45, Alstone Lane, Alstone, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Removed tree, 21st March
item.description:
This tree has been chopped down to half height. Are you going to replace it? Why is the council committed to planting more trees and yet at the same time cutting others down and leaving half a trunk? Is wrapping it in hazard tape a long term solution?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 41, Alstone Croft, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ambiguous road markings leading up to roundabout, 21st March
item.description:
The lane markings leading up to the roundabout serving Park and Ride, B&Q, and Hatherley Road and Hatherley Lane are ambiguous. They used to show park and ride for right hand lane, but this has been marked over. Now you get people using both lanes to go towards Grovefield Way. This is dangerous and confusing. Please mark the two lanes accordingly as required to remove all doubt going forward. This was reported previously but you seem to have deleted it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hatherley Lane, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues
